EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Plate Production Line (around x=1-3, y=1-3)
Consists of:
- Two stone furnaces at positions (1.0, 1.0) and (3.0, 1.0)
- Two wooden chests at positions (1.5, 3.5) and (3.5, 3.5) storing iron plates
- Two burner inserters at positions (1.5, 2.5) and (3.5, 2.5) moving plates from furnaces to chests

### Copper Plate Production Line (around x=2-4, y=7-9)
Consists of:
- Two stone furnaces at positions (2.0, 7.0) and (4.0, 7.0)
- Two wooden chests at positions (2.5, 9.5) and (4.5, 9.5) storing copper plates
- Two burner inserters at positions (2.5, 8.5) and (4.5, 8.5) moving plates from furnaces to chests

### Additional Storage/Production Area
- Burner inserter at position (5.5, 2.5)
- Wooden chest at position (5.5, 3.5)

### Power Generation System (around x=-5 to 13, y=26-35)
Consists of:
- Offshore pump at (2.5, 35.5) providing water
- Boiler at (7.0, 35.5) converting water to steam
- Steam engine at (13.5, 35.5) generating electricity
- Two pipe groups:
  - Water pipes connecting offshore pump to boiler
  - Steam pipes connecting boiler to steam engine
- Electricity distribution network with multiple electric poles

### Disconnected Structure
- Unused offshore pump at (-5.5, 26.5)

ERROR TIPS

### Water System Connection Issues
- Ensure offshore pumps are properly connected to the pipe network
- The offshore pump at (-5.5, 26.5) has no fluid connections and needs to be integrated into a system or removed

### Furnace Operation Issues
- Some furnaces are showing "no ingredients to smelt" warnings
- Ensure regular supply of raw materials to keep furnaces operational
- Monitor fuel levels in furnaces to maintain continuous operation

### Entity Placement Best Practices
- Keep related production entities close together for efficient operation
- Ensure proper connection of fluid-carrying entities (pumps, pipes, boilers)
- Plan the layout to minimize distance between related components
